metadata.title: Convert Degrees to Turns – Angle Converter
metadata.description: Convert angles from Degrees to Turns (full rotations), useful for rotational mechanics.

introduction: This converter transforms degrees to turns for rotation understanding.
Mechanical systems measured in rotations; angles in degrees.
This converter uses the relationship where 360 degrees equals 1 turn.
methodology: 1 turn = 360°. To convert degrees to turns, divide by 360.
Turns represent complete rotations, natural for rotating machinery.
Understanding degree-to-turn conversion is essential for mechanical engineering.
This converter provides precise angle conversion.

faqs.question: Why use turns instead of degrees?
faqs.answer: Natural for rotating machinery. 1 turn = one complete cycle.

faqs.question: How many RPM is 1 turn?
faqs.answer: RPM (revolutions per minute) = turns per minute. 1 RPM = 1 turn/min.

faqs.question: How do I calculate rotation distance?
faqs.answer: Distance = Radius × Angle (in radians). Or use turns with circumference.

faqs.question: What's torque vs rotational power?
faqs.answer: Torque: rotational force. Power = Torque × Angular velocity.

faqs.question: What's angular velocity?
faqs.answer: Turns per second or radians per second. Measure of rotation rate.

glossary.definition: Angular unit based on arc length.
